New Records: Sixth four-plus wicket haul for Mohammed Shami, the joint-most for any bowler in men's ODI World Cups, equalling Mitchell Starc.
Key Match Events: Mohammed Shami took 4 wickets for 22 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 32 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah led the show with the ball, removing Malan and Root off successive balls.
Shami stepped up, sending back Stokes and Bairstow.
Kuldeep Yadav castled Buttler with a ripper.
Mark Wood was bowled by Bumrah for 0, sealing England's defeat.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's character and experience, noting the challenge of batting first and the effectiveness of their bowling attack.
Jos Buttler expressed disappointment in England's performance, particularly their batting, despite a good start by the bowlers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India stay unbeaten with six wins in as many games and regain the top spot.
England remain at the bottom of the points table with their fifth defeat in six games.
